0.name: Healthy
0.description: Leaf shows normal green coloration with no visible signs of nutrient stress.
0.recommendation: Maintain current agronomic practices, ensure balanced fertilization and good field hygiene.

1.name: boron-B
1.description: Boron deficiency causes thick, brittle, or deformed leaves, often with cracked stems and poor flowering.
1.recommendation: Apply boron-containing fertilizers (e.g., borax or Solubor) in small, carefully measured amounts to avoid toxicity.

2.name: calcium-Ca
2.description: Calcium deficiency leads to distorted young leaves, tip burn, and weak cell walls.
2.recommendation: Apply agricultural lime or gypsum to improve calcium availability and maintain proper soil pH.

3.name: iron-Fe
3.description: Iron deficiency causes interveinal chlorosis (yellowing between veins) on young leaves while veins remain green.
3.recommendation: Apply foliar iron chelates (Fe-EDDHA or Fe-DTPA) and ensure soil pH is not too alkaline.

4.name: magnesium-Mg
4.description: Magnesium deficiency shows as interveinal chlorosis on older leaves, with green veins and yellow tissue.
4.recommendation: Apply magnesium sulfate (Epsom salts) or dolomitic lime to replenish magnesium levels.

5.name: manganese-Mn
5.description: Manganese deficiency causes interveinal chlorosis with small necrotic spots, usually on younger leaves.
5.recommendation: Apply manganese sulfate or foliar Mn sprays, and avoid excessive liming that raises soil pH.

6.name: nitrogen-N
6.description: Nitrogen deficiency results in uniform yellowing of older leaves, stunted growth, and reduced vigor.
6.recommendation: Apply nitrogen fertilizers such as urea, ammonium nitrate, or organic manures in split doses.

7.name: phosphorus-P
7.description: Phosphorus deficiency causes dark green or purplish leaves, poor root growth, and delayed maturity.
7.recommendation: Apply phosphorus fertilizers like triple superphosphate (TSP) or diammonium phosphate (DAP).

8.name: potasium-K
8.description: Potassium deficiency shows as leaf edge scorching, yellowing, and weak stems.
8.recommendation: Apply muriate of potash (KCl) or sulfate of potash (K2SO4) to restore potassium levels.
